title: Pandas: DataFrame Mean
story: Pandas is essential for data analysis. Test that Pandas works by calculating the mean of a dataset.
instructions: Create a Pandas DataFrame with a column 'scores' containing [85, 90, 78, 92, 88]. Print the mean of the 'scores' column.
starterCode:
import pandas as pd

# Create DataFrame and print mean
df = pd.DataFrame({'scores': [85, 90, 78, 92, 88]})
mean_score = df['scores'].mean()
print(mean_score)
solutionHidden:
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame({'scores': [85, 90, 78, 92, 88]})
mean_score = df['scores'].mean()
print(mean_score)

hints.text: Use pd.DataFrame() with a dictionary to create the DataFrame.
Access the column with df['scores'] and call .mean() method.
